alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Keokuk; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 7:13AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Keokuk, west central Washington and northwestern Jefferson Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 712 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ottumwa Industrial Airport, or 7 miles north of Ottumwa, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Martinsburg around 720 AM CDT. Hayesville around 725 AM CDT. Delta around 730 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Sigourney, Harper and South English. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
